content.description: From the high saddle between the Monster south and north summit, look right or north and there are two obvious routes. The Iowa Mountaineers, straight up (3 bolts, 5.6), and just to the right, this route. Start up and clip the first bolt, make the hardest move and move up and right past 4 more bolts and a few "coffee maker" sized jugs, to the anchors. This is a good route.
content.protection: 5 bolts, plus nice ring anchor. 50M rope=OK
content.location: From the paved pullout on the west side of SD244, just past the Profile View, park and hike up past Stardancer, etc, past the saddle, continue up east and north to the east end of the large slab east of Monster proper and hike across the slab into the gully splitting Monster. Pass the alcove after a scrambly bit and stop at the saddle. There are 2 climbs to the right, or north. Iowa is on the left or west and this climb is on the right or northeast.

content.description: This an awesome route up to the right of The Monster Within and another 5.11 whose name I cannot recall.  Start to the left of a little horizontal crack, traverse right, hop over the bulge, and make your way through the chunky quartzite above to the anchors.  Bouldery start and the remainder of the climb can be quite pumpy if rests aren't chosen correctly.
content.protection: I believe there are about seven or eight bolts on this route.

content.description: Named after the shadow the route creates late in the afternoon.  A fun well protected route  that should not be missed .  Follows a blank arete with 7 bolts. Passing the 4th is the crux.
content.location: Upper south side of the monster summit. Just left of the the two chimneys, (Monster Within 5.9). Follows arete up and left to anchors.

content.description:
This route starts near the top of the Monster formation, and goes to the top in one medium length pitch.  Follow the directions for the Monster rock around to the uphill side, then look for a steep bolted line with huge jugs to the right of a corner. 

  This is a very enjoyable jug haul.  Follow a fun line through 4 bolts or so to fixed anchors.  These anchors are also used for various other routes on Monster which have no anchors.

climbs.name: The IA Mountaineers Monster
climbs.fa: The Iowa Mountaineers Way Back in the Day

content.description: Scramble/mantle up a boulder and step on to a crystal-strewn face. Proceed up past three bolts into a long runout (where the climbing eases in difficulty while growing in exposure). One distinct slightly awkward crux move, which must have been quite interesting to do when this route had only one bolt! Not particularly memorable but seemed to flow well enough.
content.protection: This route has been tastefully retro-bolted. There are three bolts now. I seem to remember it having its own anchors as well, but my memory is hazy on that point. Might share an anchor with Sulley might not--can't remember clearly.
content.location: From the paved pullout on the west side of SD 244, just past the profile view, park and hike up east and north and across the spacious slab into the Monster Gully. Stop at the saddle. There are two climbs in front of you, IA Mountaineers on left and Sulley on right.

content.description: An excellent crack, with varying sizes. Short and easy enough to summit.~ We need a better description. Looking for an update from "the museum'. ;) I followed this on arrival and was very poor at note taking for my excitement.
content.protection: Standard rack. Only a few pieces needed.
content.location: Close to The IA Mountaineers. Up the hill and to the right of obvious alcove.

content.description: What grade do you call a flaring off width that most bodies could find placement in? Ass to wall and feet out. Awkward and trusting, transition from side to side. It does have a thinner crack on the interior where a traditional rack can get you up there. ~ I was on toprope. Ask "The Museum' for assistance.
content.location: On the left of the Alcove just up from IA mountaineers. ~ Ask 'the museum' for assistance. :)

content.description: Start either below the high flake at the bottom of the gully, or scramble up to the large flake and belay from there, OR down low and E in the gully belay from the 18" pine tree. Somehow achieve the top of the large flake, move up clip two bolts keeping you safe in retirement, and up and left to the crack amid the face. Climb the crack or alongside, or lieback, with some good pro. From a coffee maker sized bump at the top of the crack, clip the bolt nearby and head straight up, past one more bolt to the anchor.
content.protection: 2 bolts below the crack close together to prevent decking on the flake, then several pieces in the crack including medium to large stoppers, .5 BD and the bomber #1 cinnamon BD at the coffee maker sized hold. Also, there are 2 bolts above the top of the crack and then the chain anchors. Additionally, the anchor is clearly visible from the Granite Slab E of the Monster summit. The rappel from the anchor is 24 meters, 60 meter rope = OK.
content.location: The route is on the south side of the Monster summit nearer the east end. From the large granite slab E of the Monster summit, approaching the gully that splits the Monster summit, stop BEFORE you head up into the splitting gully. There are 2 chimneys on the E end, this route is BETWEEN the first 2 chimneys. Rap the route, as of this date, there isn't a second pitch. Also, without climbing another route and rapping from a horn above this route, leaving gear, there is NO TOP ROPE opp.

content.description: Great place to escape the wind/heat. Gets AM sun. Lots of fun moderate routes.
